channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: China moves to consolidate a position of strength as pandemic fades
item.description: Sometimes, the best time to act isn't when you're at your strongest, but when your rivals are weakest.

item.title: Australia angered China by calling for a coronavirus investigation. Now Beijing is targeting it
item.description: It didn't take long after Australia's first calls for an international investigation into the origins of the coronavirus pandemic before rumblings of retaliation came from Beijing.

item.title: 'What a little man,' Anderson Cooper reacts to Trump's falsehoods
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper excoriates President Trump and calls him a "little man" for spreading falsehoods about a deceased woman.

item.title: Twitter labeled Trump tweets with a fact check for the first time
item.description: For the first time, Twitter has labeled a tweet from President Donald Trump as misleading.

item.title: Trump takes his war on masks to new heights
Choir practice turned into a Covid-19 'super spreader' event
item.description: CNN's Randi Kaye reports on rising concerns over potential coronavirus 'super spreader' events and the implications these have on infection transmission.

item.title: Brazil surpasses US daily coronavirus death toll
Antibody tests for Covid-19 wrong half the time, CDC says
item.description: Antibody tests used to determine if people have been infected in the past with Covid-19 might be wrong up to half the time, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said in new guidance posted on its website.

item.title: White woman who called police on a black man bird-watching in Central Park has been fired
item.description: The white woman who called police on a black man in Central Park during an encounter involving her unleashed dog has been fired from her job, her employer said Tuesday.

item.title: Family of black man who died in police custody demands justice
item.description: The family of George Floyd, a black man who was held down with a knee as he protested that he couldn't breathe and later died in police custody, speaks with CNN's Don Lemon.

item.title: There's one epidemic we may never find a vaccine for: fear of black men in public spaces
item.description: Millions of Americans shrugged off their fear of the coronavirus this holiday weekend when they flocked to crowded beaches, lakes and restaurants.

item.title: Video shows a woman pushing her 9-year-old son into a canal, police say
item.description: Newly released video obtained by CNN network partner Univision shows the moment a Florida woman who's been arrested in the death of her 9-year-old son pushes him into a canal.

item.title: She was tricked as a teen into prostitution. Now she faces starvation
The world sacrificed its elderly in the race to protect hospitals
Brazilian president called mayor 'a piece of s***.' See mayor's response.
item.description: Brazil now has the second most infections worldwide after the United States, but its president Jair Bolsonaro, is urging business to reopen. CNN's Nick Paton Walsh tells us more.

item.title: Hong Kong police surround legislature ahead of protests over national anthem bill
13-year-old boy earns four associate's degrees
item.description: A 13-year-old boy in California has graduated from college with four associate's degrees.

item.title: Japan to discuss cyberbullying laws after death of wrestler
item.description: Japanese government officials are calling for action against cyberbullying, amid a national outpouring of grief after the death of professional wrestler and reality television star Hana Kimura.

item.title: Joe Biden responds to Trump on masks: 'He's a fool'
item.description: In an interview with CNN's Dana Bash, Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden hit back at President Donald Trump over wearing a mask, and his ability to lead the country.

item.title: Europe's rebound from coronavirus is threatened
item.description: A fight over how to fund the European Union's recovery from the coronavirus pandemic is stoking tensions between wealthier and poorer countries, threatening to delay the region's economic rebound and unleash political and financial forces that could pull the bloc apart.

item.title: Earthquake hits while world leader was live on TV
item.description: A magnitude 5.8 earthquake struck near New Zealand's capital Wellington while the country's Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern was discussing New Zealand's ongoing lifting of coronavirus restrictions in a live interview.

item.title: Dutch leader did not visit dying mother for weeks to comply with lockdown rules
item.description: Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte was unable to visit his mother in the weeks leading up to her death due to coronavirus restrictions, but he did stay with her on her final night, his spokesman told CNN Tuesday.

item.title: Pentagon deputy inspector general resigns, becomes latest watchdog to exit administration
item.description: A top internal watchdog at the Pentagon, Glenn Fine, submitted his resignation Tuesday, more than a month after President Donald Trump effectively removed him as chairman of the Pandemic Response Accountability Committee, a group of independent watchdogs tasked with overseeing $2 trillion in emergency coronavirus funding.

item.title: This country seemed to do everything right. So how did it become a Covid-19 hotspot?
Watch landing of last resort in virus hotbed
item.description: Planes are bringing some of the sickest Covid-19 patients from hundreds of miles away to Manaus, Brazil's hardest-hit city. CNN's Nick Paton Walsh reports.

item.title: A space launch 'saved' 1968. If only it could do the same for 2020
item.description: In 1968, the pioneering Apollo 8 lunar orbit mission lifted America's morale in a bitter year of political assassinations, race and anti-war riots, the fading presidency of Lyndon Johnson and a hardening Cold War.

item.title: Why we're rocketing people into space -- even in the middle of a pandemic
item.description: So we're back to scanning the skies along Florida's northeast coast for clouds -- to see whether it's clear out enough that we can shoot a rocket into space with two people in it.

item.title: France to inject almost $9 billion into ailing auto industry
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron has announced an $8.8 billion aid package for the country's embattled auto industry, which has seen sales tank during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: This is what touring Spain this summer could look like
item.description: CNN's Atika Shubert reports on plans underway in Spain to ease foreign travel restrictions in an effort to welcome back tourists, despite concerns over Covid-19.

item.title: 4 Minneapolis cops fired after video shows one kneeling on neck of black man who later died
item.description: Minneapolis police officers involved in the death of a black man who they held down as he protested that he couldn't breathe have been placed on leave as the FBI looks into the incident, Police Chief Medaria Arradondo said Tuesday.

item.title: CNN's Brianna Keilar pushes state official on his promise to Trump
item.description: After President Trump has repeatedly railed on mail-in voting, Alabama Secretary of State John Merrill tweeted that his state would not allow mail-in ballots but would provide absentee ballots for those who do not feel safe voting at the poles due to the coronavirus.

item.title: People are buying lots of booze, but global alcohol sales are still tanking
item.description: People are buying a lot of booze, but it's not enough to prevent an overall downturn that will take the industry several years to recover.

item.title: Astronomers discover 'cosmic ring of fire' formed when two galaxies collide
item.description: Images of Galaxy R5519 show a rare "cosmic ring of fire" thought to have formed when two galaxies collide.

item.title: He asked Twitter to remove Trump's false tweets about his dead wife. Twitter refused
item.description: Six times this month, in a vile attempt to punish a political rival, President Trump has tweeted about a decades-old conspiracy theory about MSNBC's Joe Scarborough.

item.title: Costa Rica becomes the first Central American country to legalize same-sex marriage
item.description: Marriage equality is now law in Costa Rica.

item.title: Masks are too dangerous for children under two, Japanese experts warn
item.description: Wearing masks has become increasingly common during the coronavirus pandemic, but they should not be used by children under the age of two, according to the Japan Pediatric Association.

item.title: Denmark allows cross-border 'sweethearts' to reunite -- on one condition
item.description: Lockdowns and social distancing restrictions have pushed couples apart around the world. But Denmark is now allowing some citizens in cross-border relationships to reunite with their partners.

item.title: Stanley Ho, Hong Kong billionaire and Macao's 'godfather of gambling,' dies at 98
item.description: Stanley Ho, Macao gambling tycoon and one of Hong Kong's first billionaires, has died at the age of 98, his family said on Tuesday.

item.title: The asteroid that wiped out the dinosaurs hit at 'deadliest possible' angle
item.description: The city-size asteroid that hit Earth 66 million years ago and doomed the dinosaurs to extinction came from the northeast at a steep angle, maximizing the amount of climate-changing gases unleashed into the atmosphere, a new study has found.

item.title: Discrimination towards Africans in China goes back decades
item.description: A black version of the Chinese flag swept across African Twitter earlier this month, as users replaced their avatars to express their anger at the government of China.

item.title: Latin America's largest airline files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy
Virgin Orbit rocket cuts short crucial test flight
item.description: Virgin Orbit experienced a hiccup Monday with the launch demo of its two-stage orbital rocket from a 747 aircraft.

item.title: Massive saber-toothed anchovies once existed. Yes, anchovies
item.description: The anchovies we know today are small, plankton-eating fish that often flavor our Caesar salads and pizzas.

item.title: Royal reveals what scares him about being a father
item.description: Prince William opened up in a new BBC documentary "Football, Prince William and Our Mental Health," about grief over the loss of his mother, Princess Diana, that resurfaced when he became a father.

item.title: A wrongfully convicted man freed after 36 years is now an 'America's Got Talent' favorite
item.description: The new season of "America's Got Talent" already has a frontrunner, and his episode hasn't even aired yet. But he's got a story -- and a voice -- for the ages.

item.title: Gucci abandons 'worn-out ritual' of fashion seasons as the industry looks inward
item.description: Gucci's creative director Alessandro Michele has announced that the brand is permanently abandoning the traditional fashion calendar as the industry rethinks how it operates in the light of Covid-19.

item.title: Kendall Jenner's 'twin' steps into spotlight in new show
item.description: There's a new reality show from the Kardashian-Jenner family, but it has a twist. The show centers around a 24-year-old performance artist who has risen to fame over the past five years with his parody Instagram account, where he pretends to be the fraternal twin brother of Kendall Jenner.

item.title: Nail-biting video shows brown bear following child on family hike
item.description: An Italian family's mountain hike took a hair-raising turn after a brown bear followed a child down a mountain path during a day out.

item.title: Behind-the-scenes of the American South's growing indy film industry
item.description: In the past decade the American South has become a nexus of film production. Over a year ending summer 2019, $2.9 billion was invested into Georgia alone, as a result of productions choosing to film in the state.

item.title: Flight to Italy resumes only to find airport shut when it gets there
item.description: We're all pretty excited about being able to travel again -- but German airline Eurowings might be more eager than most.
